dmca.title: [ABUSE] Re: ApexSearchEngineMarketing.com]
dmca.body:
NC

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Monday, May 09, 2005 8:51 AM
To: andrea@alrgroup.com
Cc: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Re: ApexSearchEngineMarketing.com]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being sent to our copyright-related legal counsel at the
address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Re: ApexSearchEngineMarketing.com
Date: Fri, 06 May 2005 20:30:51 -0400
From: Andrea La-Rosa <andrea@alrgroup.com>
Reply-To: andrea@alrgroup.com
Organization: The ALR Group
To: abuse@theplanet.com

Hello there.

I am a web site developer.  I was recently hired by
ApexSearchEngineMarketing.com, which is hosted on your servers, to design a
web site for him.  He's written to me to inform me that he has no intention
of paying me for my work. I deleted the site from his servers, and he put it
back and changed the FTP information and further informed me - again in
writing- that he had no intention of paying for use of the graphics and
layout design.  Basically, I have written proof that this man is using your
hosting services for theft and copyright infringement.

I am happy to forward all email and correspondence between us with full
headers. I am confident that using your servers to house copyright
infringing articles - which make you guys liable too - is firmly against
your policies. You can look on your server files that the part about me
uploading things yesterday and then deleting, then him changing the FTP info
and reuploading are all true.

Please advise what I can do to help you look into this matter. I am a
low-income single mother that works freelance web design to support myself
and my severely disabled small child; he didn't owe me very much money
($200) but it's a lot of money to ME, and I'd like to know that I have some
recourse for this bald-faced horrible behavior.

I thank you in advance for any help.

Andrea La-Rosa
http://www.alrgroup.com
786-290-8410


- --
Thanks,
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Thunderbird - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD4DBQFCf2revK/XpJs6oyURAjj5AJdpFxJBghLU3ELf1sM5Vy9kYB1yAJwI3f71
5GtLGl0+tteIBEinY52Q9A==
=EjXQ
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
